problem: On Monday, I worked $t-6$ hours and earned $2t-5$ dollars per hour. My friend Andrew worked $2t-8$ hours but only earned $t-5$ dollars an hour. As it turns out, we earned the same amount. What is the value of $t$?
solution:
Since we both earned the same amount, \begin{align*}
(t-6) (2t-5) &= (2t-8)(t-5) \\
\Rightarrow \qquad 2t^2-17t+30 &= 2t^2 - 18t+ 40.
\end{align*}Simplifying gives $t = \boxed{10}$.
chatgpt_solution:
Andrew earned $(2t-8)(t-5)$ dollars and you earned $(t-6)(2t-5)$ dollars. Both these dollar amounts are equal to $2t^2-18t+40$. Thus, we have \begin{align*}
(t-6)(2t-5)&=(2t-8)(t-5)\\
t(2t-5)-(6)(2t-5)&=2t(t-4)-(8)(t-4)\\
2t^2-5t-12t+30&=2t^2-8t-4t+32\\
2t^2-17t+30&=2t^2-12t+32\\
-17t+30&=-12t+32\\
-17t+12t&=32-30\\
-5t&=2.
\end{align*} Dividing $-5t=2$ by $-5$ will give us the solution $t=\boxed{-\frac{2}{5}}.$
